sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of natural disaster occurring in a region
message_1: A region is hit by a major earthquake every 10 years on average. What is the probability of this region being hit by a major earthquake in a given year?
message_2:
Since a major earthquake occurs every 10 years on average, the probability of a major earthquake occurring in a given year can be calculated as the reciprocal of the average interval between earthquakes.

Probability = 1 / (Average interval between earthquakes)

In this case, the average interval between earthquakes is 10 years.

Probability = 1 / 10 = 0.1

So, the probability of this region being hit by a major earthquake in a given year is 0.1 or 10%.
